Ratings.comment: Her attendance policy was strict. The lessons were long. There was a lot of projects. Even though there was a mid semester check in for your work, it felt like you were being monitored almost all the time. For me this course was very exhausting for a GE. She certainly cares about students, but she was not for me.

Carmel was an amazing professor! Her class is easy if you attend and do the work. The amount of art projects can get demanding at times, but since the class is so long you have plenty of time to get them done in class. Despite this, she is generally just a great person and fun to be around. I am glad I took this class to fulfill a GE requirement.

The class was very enjoyable! While there were a lot of projects most of them were able to be completed inside of class. She mainly graded off of participation. She just wanted you to try your best and improve your skills over the semester!

I had class with Professor Buckley Fall of 1997. It started off rockily (the very first project, which was my first time using wire, was probably the worst art experience of my entire life), and I considered dropping it. I'm glad I didn't. She proved to be a wealth of knowledge and a fair grader. She even floated me a loan to finish a project.

Carmel is so kind and passionate about her job. The course isn't easy, but that's not her fault; she delegates the workload well. She is a caring professor, don't hesitate to ask for help if you're drowning.

Not an easy GE if you are taking with Carmel. You will end up working on art more than your major classes. My friends took it with aa different professor and only had like 2-3 projects. However, for us, it was 7-9 projects. Would not recommend anyone taking it with Carmel.

Easily the worst class I've taken so far. I found myself constantly having to redo my drawings or add more in order to satisfy her. The class was initially set up fine, but as she moved things around, it meant I had to do more outside of class. This meant having to cart a massive drawing board to some obscure building and spend hours drawing.

I loved having Carmel as a teacher. She was super invested in all of her students and really cared that you were understanding everything. Her feedback was super helpful but some found her projects a bit overwhelming. Be prepared to put in a good amount of effort in and out of class. As long as you do your best, it's a great class.
This class was very easy and as long as I turned in the assignments I got perfect grades, there was a decent amount of work involved but never an overwhelming amount

Yes, you have to be open minded in this class to the instructor's feedback, but it pays off. Also, Carmel is extremely understanding and was willing to accommodate my schedule in her class. All in all, if you care and work hard you will do just fine.

Carmel is a great professor but can be difficult to please with your concepts. She is very critical when it comes to the design and build process but was ultimately more interested in effort than the final product. She may not love the concept or final product but greatly understands work ethic and rewards in the end. You'll work for your grade.

she can be unclear but she does want her students to do well. Though it might be frustrating often, if you take her advice and are open to letting her change your ideas (which kinda sucks sometimes), then she will help you push your ideas further in a good way.

Carmel is an outstanding teacher.  As long as you have decent ideas and put work into them, you'll do well in the class.  I was so scared to take this class but its been one of my all time favorites of all the classes ive taken in college.
Good artist.  Good person.  Bad teacher.

She was a good person other than the fact that some of her comments canceled each other out. She also wanted you to create what she wanted and make it into your own idea. You can't be lazy and expect to get a good grade, put the work and time into your projects, she doesn't want you to do bad in the class. She wants to help you!

The worst instructor I've ever had. She's one of those teachers that demands everyone produce the same thing. Don't even attempt to do anything outside of what she wants cause you'll be shot down instantly. A horrible person, a horrible instructor. Thank god I will out live her.

She has an absolute, encyclopedic memory of contemporary art history.  At the drop of the hat, she will recommend an artist for further reflection.  Sheâ€™s completely lovely, a princess...stuck in the Midwest you'll find her instruction a breath of fresh air. Rewarding to anyone willing to exert oneself.  She's the best instructor at OSU.

If she doesn't agree with your overall concept, you're doomed.  Good execution will buy you nothing.  Problem is, we're not all the same artist.  She wants everyone to do well, but she wants them all to do the same kind of thing as well.  It is easy to play her game and get a good grade.  I wasn't really interested in just grades.
I agree she's not the kindest, but that not why she's there....that's the real world of art critique
Extremely generous with her time and energy.
I loved her class and her instruction. She's an amazing artist who really cares and brings out the best in her students.
by far the worst art teacher I ever had. Completely unkind and cold.  I wish I had something nice to say but I do not.  consider 3D with another instructor, even if it rearranges your schedule.
she was insensitive, unkind and made art task oriented. I have never had a more thoughtless demeaning teacher
If your name is Luke, she will pay attention to you. Otherwise, sorry.
No Comments

Amy is super nice, and really cares about your art and projects. She is also very strict about deadlines and participation so missing a few classes really can hurt your grade but all long as you show up and give effort your grade should be fine
loved having amy as an instructor. she encourages you to push your ideas further but grades reasonably and fairly

She is known for pushing students to take a different direction in their art then pretending she has no idea where you got such a bad idea from. On the other hand, if you ignore her ideas for your work she will make passive/aggressive comments relating to her idea and your grade will be lowered because of it.
Amazingly inspirational prof.
she's simply amazing!! I couldn't ask for more in a professor.

One of my first art teachers and she was awesome!  She's an understanding person for sure and gives great feedback.  If your lazy and like to get by as  a art student, she won't give you a hard time, but will question you for sure, so be ready to take responsibility for your work. she's fun (hyper) and great personality.
Amy is a great instructor and is great artist as well.  She is understanding and very open to various interpretations of work.  A fun course backed by a fun teacher is a sure win.
shes unposible to please dont even try, if all posible dont have her as a teacher, change other classes if need be
Amy was one of the best professors I've ever had. Very positive and helpful, but also honest about your work. It was a pleasure to have had her for a teacher.

Ratings.comment: Worst professor I have ever had. Made some pretty awful comments to not only myself but lots of my peers. If you can, TAKE ANOTHER CLASS WITH ANOTHER PROF

He rejects any kind of original thought. Be prepared to budget $40 per assignment as a bare minimum, because he will insist on you going and getting different materials every time you come to class. He assumes you have unlimited funds and ability to travel. He will never give any sort of praise or positive feedback. Same energy as Alison Crocetta.

Taking intro to 3d art with Todd was like pulling teeth. He contradicts himself, he insults students,and his rubrics feel like they depend on the phase of the moon and whether mercury is in retrograde or not. he's extremely condescending and inconsiderate. If you want to do well, you need to be willing to fight him for any useful critique.

I can't even begin to describe how terrible of an educator Todd is. Expect to leave class crying at least twice. It was easier to stay confused than ask for help, because he just made things more confusing. He grades easy though, which is surprising given his high level of difficulty. If you're not an artist, dont take this class! SAVE YOURSELF!!!

Todd is a very kind person and a thoughtful instructor. His instructions are confusing so don't be afraid to ask him to clarify, but he means well. His assignments are extremely difficult, but they were the only time I felt genuinely challenged by OSU's art program. His class will give you a giant headache but in my opinion it's worth it.

He's well meaning, a great artist, but his introductory 3D art class is brutal. A solid class for a sculpture major, but a big mistake for a non-art major. He's very forgetful and sometimes gives contradictory advice. Prepare for 12+ hours working on projects out of class every week if you want to pass.
very confusing professor

He is awkwardly hilarious and gives really confusing or utterly useless advice, which he will certainly forget telling you in a few days. If you just completely ignore anything he has to say and make things that you want that you can loosely tie in to what he wants you'll be fine as long as you deliver on the goods.

If you have any choice in what Beginnning Sculpture teacher to take, avoid him.  If the ideas and concepts in your piece don't match with his, or you don't follow what he has in mind exactly, your grade will suffer. He doesn't remember what he tells you from day to day, and expects WAY too much for an intro class. Very uncomfortable studio class.

Todd is a really great instructor.  YES, he is challenging. But I also thought that that was the point of art school.  Oh well, not everyone can be a strong artist, right?  Everyone is so touchy and wants to be praised all the time- but the fact is that 99% of art students are lazy and talentless. only 1% will have a career in art. and it's not you
I suggest finding another teacher. This guy was extremely difficult to understand, and grades very, very hard.
Downright unfair! You won't get an A in his class no matter how hard you try. Plus he didn't teach us a thing. He sucked!

i don't know what alien inhabited his body, but i loved him last quarter.  he may not understand what you are going for and try to talk you into something else, but if you just smile and nod and go about your buisness, everything works out because he won't remember that he told you to do something.  and i dunno, but he was funny too.
No Comments

very difficult personality.  i felt like he always offered help, but rarely followed up on the offer.  communication is hard.  often i would write things down that he said in class so i could remind him later that he said it.  keeping a record is vital!  i was very dissappointed with my learning experience.
Very hard to work with, he doesnt let you do your projects that you want to do, your project becomes his by the time he is done "brainstorming" with you
No Comments
He is very harsh but will work with you any time you want it.  If you don't see eye to eye, maybe listening is a good idea.  Rewards hard work but more importantly, well developed concept.
This class is not easy, but you learn a lot about art.  You just have to put in the time and effort and be open to changing your ideas.
he made three people cry in my class, and they weren't all girls.
This guy is a tremendous artist!  His input is more valuable than most people in my life, and he's a super nice guy.
I had an incredible experience with Todd- he was so helpful, a switch from mst of the other profs. A+++++ rated
What can I say about Todd, He tries to teach, but hes getting old.  Just make sure he is still breathing.
worst teacher ever
Tough, and often obtuse but certainly invested in teaching.
No Comments
Best professor I've ever had at Ohio State. I really enjoyed reading his long weekly emails and he gives great feedback on your work. The textbook is free btw.
Dan is that rare professor that leaves you inspired and working your butt off to learn as much as possible from him.

Great prof, left his class every time pumped on life ready to conquer the world. Technically had class twice a week but he only made us come every monday. NOTHING bad to say, gives everyone an A as long as you put in the effort (show up to class, talk, turn everything in), he doesn't grade you based on good you videos are. Overall: da bomb

Dan knows the business and his lectures have an unrivaled rhythm and flow.  He transitions from one topic to the next seamlessly and is the only prof I've had who can hold my attention solid for over 3 hours.

Dan has a genuine interest in helping you become a better artist. He has many interesting theories on art and education. His lectures can be very intense, but he's funny as hell, well sometimes... if you like to have some fun while you learn, he's the guy, if you want a stuffy deadpan prof he's not the guy. get ready to get crazy!
Great teacher. The comment someone left on how this class is "everything college should be but sometimes isn't" nails it right on the head.
Aewsome.  Helpful.  Motivated. Teaches becaues he wants to, its not his full time job!  Take his classes!
Dan is awesome!  His class is great, and he is hilarious.  He is also an amazing artist and his stuff rocks.  Take his class, seriously.  He is so cool.

Best.Teacher.EVER.  My favorite teacher in the art department.  I took 3 of his classes so far (because I [heart] him so much!!), and each class was the most fun I've had in school for a very long time.  He's super fun, hyper, positive, very open-minded, and appreciative of your hard work and creativity.  Trust me--you will love his class.  :o)
Dan is my hero.  He has inspired me more than anyother teacher has in a long time.  If I could clone him I would.

He is the best teacher in the WORLD. If you want to make yourself a favor take his class! I think Dan should be nominated for best teacher award. He makes you think and work, you want to do things cause he cares!
Easily the best teacher in the art department. Give that man tenure track, you fools!
He is amazing... His classes are awesome - you learn, you have fun, you can think, you can speak, everything college is supossed to be (yet sometimes isn't).
enthusiastic, informative, and fun
Poor professor. Not well organized and gives little feedback. Would not recommend as a professor.

Tough grader and instead of helping students understand concepts, she advised to read her feedback to others, which she posted in the public forum instead of in the private student feedback section. Her advice was for students to mimic those she praised and not those she ridiculed. This was an odd style, and one I had not seen before.
She was a great teacher. The class was so ridiculously easy. She was a bit unorganized but all together it was a great class.
Sarah is a pleasure.
I loved Sarah. She was so great and cute. A pleasure to be around and learn from.

Treated different students in different ways.  Was a nicer person to the women in the class and was more difficult if you were a male.  disorganized and unclear with assignments.  2d 206m was the class in question.

Sarah was totally disorganized.  We spent over half the quarter on the first project, then tried to cram in like a project a week for the last part of the quarter.  It took her forever to express assignments, and her assignments were often self defeating.  Avoid this flustered woman at all costs.  She's nice, but you'll be pulling out your hair.

(Beginning Drawing) This class was great. I had a lot of fun and Sarah made the class great for everyone no matter what your art background! I really recommend her if you have to take any art classes.
As an engineering student interested in 3D I was really thrilled to learn about modeling and building my works.
As an engineering student interested in 3D I was really thrilled to learn so much in this course about both modeling and manufacturing my work.

My two biggest problems with Ken are: 1) He doesn't take the time to show you how to make an actual work of art with the programs he teaches. He just deforms a cube. He is too reliant on students being self sufficient because he's not skilled enough to actually teach something specific. 2) He has no respect for commercial art, only gallery art.

This was my first class with Ken. He was extremely welcoming and encouraging of me. He inspired me to create works I am now very proud of. The focus of this class was to create great work, not get good grades, although a good grade will come from a lot of effort. Ken doesn't boast but he is a really successful artist with inspiring works of his own

My classes with him were my first experience in the art department with honest, constructive, and occasionally blunt feedback. I appreciate this, especially since so many other classes are scared of any criticism. He really does want all his students to succeed.
Excellent professor.

Changes his opinions too often on whims and doesn't explain his changes and expects you to already know them and be in line with them. Has a very specific idea of how art should be made and its frustrating when its not something you agree with. Isn't accessable when needed, often leaves class early.
Ken was very helpful whenever students needed help on a project. He had very high standards for everyone but this pushed us to create our best work. Would highly recommend.

Ken is a great professor. The thing about his classes, though, is that his sole purpose is to help you build your portfolio. If the course says you'll be learning 3D modelling, it's a lie. You will be learning 3D for about a week in total. The rest will be arts and crafts and critique days. Great class, just not as advertised. Still recommended. 2

The course is challenging esp. for those unfamiliar working with computers. However, he is very patient and will work with you one on one. He wants to see everyone exceed so he does push (and push) everyone to do their best, and although at times its frustrating, it works. He brings out in you what you never knew you were capable of. Incredible man

Great and inspirational Professor. My favorite class at OSU and inspired me to continue in art. Professor pushes you to be unique in your art. This was class so much fun and would do it all over again!
Great professor, wants you to succeed
Ken is the best professor forever! I will pick any possible classes that teach by him!
Professor Rinaldo is incredible. Class structure encourages students to explore their own interests.

Many good profs at OSU but, Prof. Rinaldo is simply the best of the best. He will push you to do your very best work. His class focuses on student growth and development, and the grade is just a biproduct. He goes above and beyond to help students. If you eager to learn taking a class Rinaldo will be an absolutely transformative experience.

Excellent teacher! The class itself was a challenge because the subject was a little more difficult. We started every class by looking at what other artist are doing in the world which I found to be extremely helpful. He really wants to see his students succeed and gives great demonstrations. Always will to meet with me and help with my project.

Ken was a real mentor througout my entire run as an Art and Tech undergrad at Ohio State.  He's no pushover and his classes can be very challenging, but they're truly worth the work.  He gave me conceptual insight and an new understanding of the possibitilities that new media has to offer.  I highly recommend this proffesor!

To teach robotics focused to the art is something that single few people can make it with so much master.I studied electronic engineering in another university and I never found somebody that showed me the wonderful things of the robotics and technology. I consider that Ken is the best teacher that I ever had.As person he is humble & charismatic
ken gots good connections, and is very helpful at pushing ones self to expand on their ideas

art 551 was one of the most rewarding experiences i had at ohio state.  so much that i repeated the course.  i feel very lucky to have worked with ken and would recommend him and his courses to any student.

Ken is one of the best instructors I have worked with in my time at Ohio State. He is honest, helpful, and insightful. Ken has always offered useful constructive criticism to my works and has played a large role in my own personal development as an artist.

I was not fluent in English, but Ken was very helpful in that aspect and also technically and artistically. He has tons of experience working with a wide range of students. He welcomes anybody no matter if they don't know about robotics. He is one of a few best teachers who stood beside me for my art career throughout my collage life.

I really loved Ken as a teacher because he expected a lot from me, both creatively and technically. He covered an amazing amount of information, and at times I had trouble keeping up because I was use to less demanding classes. He was always willing to help me if I scheduled a time to meet and I did my homework ahead of time.

Prof. Rinaldo is easily one of the best professors I had during my education. His advice over the years was invaluable, both in my artistic and academic careers. He is loaded with information about almost any topic you can think of. If you are SERIOUS and PASSIONATE  about art, I recommend taking as many courses with Prof. Rinaldo as you can.

For any students that are ranking Ken poorly, they may have misunderstood his teaching methods. Yes, he is difficult, especially compared to other sterotypical do nothing art school "hippies", but he is honest. If you are interested in a serious career in art, he will set you straight within the first week of class. His guidance is unmatched.

Ken Rinaldo has to be hands down one of my favorite professors of all-time. I just graduated with****laude distinction from Ohio State University and he has helped me immensely with the development of my art and the way in which i percieve art as a whole.

Ken will tell you anything to get you into the class & promise you the world in the form of help with the electrncs & mechncs-like:"Of Course I know all about that & will tell you just what to do!"  In my case that was a big fat lie!  My proj. was ruined do to his "all knowing" specifications & he acted shocked when confronted about his "promises"!

Ken's class was fun but very challenging.  He's knows his stuff and is a nice guy, though he is a professor / academic.  His courses have ambitious objectives for ambitious people - and he expects hard work and thought that yeilds successful projects.
No Comments

Steve yao is by far my inspiration. Coming out of high school, I never valued my learning, and thought of it as boring and redundant. Steve has changed my entire perspective on the value of education. His inspirational and hilarious lectures have allowed me to fully appreciate all that this great university has to offer. Best professor, no doubt.
The best math teacher anyons one could have
Steve Yao is an awesome dance teacher!
Great prof, easy class.  Definitely take if you are interested in learning how to dance.  Also, he puts a lot of resources on the web, if you use that sort of thing.

Steve was an awesome teacher and I greatly enjoyed his class.  Me and another person in the class sustained injuries during the quarter, and he was very flexible with us and gave us other ways to make up for not being able to participate in class.  Great guy, highly recommend.

Honestly a pretty cool guy and a pretty cool class. Class project was to eat at Taste of OSU. Dancing was lots of fun and he knows his stuff, but you learn so much that you can get lost. Not that it matters.

Steve Might be one of the greatest professors ever, He is a really fun guy to talk to and easy going.  His class Is really really fun and he's a very good dancer.  Take his Class, It might be the best thing you do at Ohio State.
Steve rocks the world.  I took social dance 2 with him and learned so much, and definitely looked forward to class.  Steve made it amazing!

i took both social dance 1 & 2 from steve.  he is a great teacher, funny guy, and really breaks down the dance into its principle components so you learn it easily.  i loved going to class.  our level 2 class was especially close.  definitely recommend him!!
cool
Sweet
Steve Yao is good, but not as good as Professor A Sinha.

Steve is a great teacher and his class is amazing! I already took social dance one with a different instructor, but taking social dance 2 with Steve really made me a lot better-he's super helpful, and he makes the class fun!
Professor Yao is amazing!!!! Highly recommend this class!!:)
No Comments
No Comments
Great prof
Social Dance Class with Mr. Yao was great. He helped the class feel comfortable learning new dances and I really enjoyed the class. Thank you.
this class was a lot of fun and i really enjoyed it and steve was an awesome instructor and lots of help

A very nice and understanding teacher, who wants you to learn and have fun while doing so. He made the class very comfortable and would spend as much time as needed helping anyone. I highly reccomend this teacher, and plan on taking all the rest of the courses offered that he teaches. Definitely one of the best teachers that I have ever had!

One of the most helpful, entertaining, cool professors I have had. I loved to go class because of his teaching style and inclusion of everyone in the group and what was going on. I learned a lot for the future for sure!
He is very clear with his instructions so I had no problem learning the steps. He is also very accomidating when needed.
Steve was awesome! He was sooo much fun and so willing to help you.  Definitely a teacher worth taking!

This class is great.  Not only is it fun, but teaches great moves to swoon women.  Meet new people, dance with all the girls.  I recommend this class to everyone, and all my friends.  I plan on minoring in it.
Very good teacher- very fun and full of life! Made things very exciting and fun to learn and apply our skills! Awesome personality and overall enjoyable person to be around!
steve is a great teacher and makes class VERY fun!!!
very good teacher, very personable, helpful, able to communicate technical dance moves very well, his teaching style seemed to be enjoyed by all

Steve is a very encouraging and passionate teacher! He is highly observant and sensitive to the needs of each student in the class. Makes dance fun and interesting for somebody least experienced in the field, like me! Good job, Steve!!

I forget the number of the class, but it was totally fantastic.  I am not a good dancer and have always been extremely self conscious about it(dancing).  Steve taught me in a way that made me feel comfortable and now I actually enjoy it.  Thanks Steve, keep up the kick ass work.
I absolutely loved this class!  I miss it so much and wish I could take it again.
Steve was awesome.  He really helps to show you the right form, and wants to teach you the most important points.

I loved this class, and looked forward to going every monday. It taught me so much about dancing, and I have been dancing for all my life! Mr. Yao is a fun and fair teacher and really cares about his students and his forte.
simply fantastic!!!
great instructor, seems genuinely interested in helping his students learn.
A valuable asset to the university, Steveâ€™s teaching techniques shine through in every class.
clear, encouraging, humorous teacher and dancer
Steve was the best dance teacher you could ask for, I have recommended this class to all of my friends and would definitely do the same for anybody reading this! A++
Awesome teacher; great sense of humor, good teacher, very clear.  I personally wanted to learn social dancing, but even they ppl who didn't want to be there enjoyed the class.
Great guy, great teacher, great class! Highly Recommended!
I love this class and Steve makes it fun!

OSU needs to get with it & hire Mr. Yao full-time!  His classes are a great example of what Ohio State should offer, and I hope OSU realizes the importance of the body, mind, & spirit connection.  This class actually helped me destress & do better in my other studies. Mr. Yao is an A+ instructor.

Steve is an awesome teacher. He makes the class fun and enjoyable for everyone. I loved going to class every single week. He is also very helpful when it comes to learning the dances and helps everyone out. He also proved through his dancing skills that he is the smoothest man alive!
He's a great guy and teacher!
Excellent teacher. adapts to student requests while teaching the fundametnals. Good sense of humor and command of the situation at all times.
he's a great teacher and i like him a lot
Best teacher ever.......period
he was a great teacher i enjoyed the class very much

Steve is one of the few instructors at Ohio State who shows actual friendliness and enthusiasm toward his students.  You can tell that he loves to dance and even more importantly, that he loves to teach.  I am often asked in my Social Dance 2 class by students of different previous instructors how I already know so many moves.  My reply: Steve Yao.
Steve Yao is an easy going wonderful professor.  He answers all of your questions and is always willing to change up the standard routine to make his class more enjoyable.
Very fun guy. The class was relaxed, yet intense. I hope to take social dance 2 with him.
He is excellent at teaching dance and very much liked by all the students.

Very good teacher.  Went over things and made it easy to learn, made sure everyone knew what they were doing, and repeated it enough so we could see all the details.  He made it so that non-dancers understood the moves as well.  I really enjoyed the class!
An excellent teacher who is more like a friend to everyone..
One of the greatest professors I've ever had.  Definately knows his stuff about dancing too.

Steve is enthusiastic and passionate about the subjects/dances he teaches, make class fun for students. He is extremely resonable/fair about grading. Steve is fun to be around... all around great instructor!
lots of fun!
Very knowledgeable and interested in helping students.

Awesome! Very much prepared us for the future engagements where we will have to dance. (weddings, ceremonies, etc.) Great break from all of the other classes I have to take. It helped to balance out my tough science schedule.
awesome teaching, very nice and accomodating, made the class fun yet informative, great job
He was an awesome instructor and he made a dance class what it should be.... FUN! Three cheers for steve!
Excellent instructor. He's an excellent dancer himself and I learned so much. I really enjoyed the optional swing dance jumps, my boyfriend and I still try those!
Steve made the steps simple.  He was very helpful.  When I did my project and taught others how to dance it was very difficult, but Steve makes it look so easy.
great teacher
I really enjoyed this class, I would take it again in a heartbeat! It wasn't to hard, but it was challenging and always fun. I would recommend it to all my friends, in fact, I think I did.
best teacher i've ever had
He's a natural teacher, and especially good with those of us who aren't naturally graceful.
gotta love steve!
Great communicator.  Very funny.
I didn't think that I would enjoy dancing... Then I had Steve as a teacher.
very good class to take. I was very shy about dancing before the class, but now I like it a lot.
Steve is extremely good at what he does. It's a lot of fun to be in his class and you learn a lot. Steve is not only a great teacher, but a good guy to hang with.
Steve is amazing.  I'm having so much fun and learning a lot because that's how he makes it.
Totally comfortable atmosphere.  Clear explanation and demonstration of task at hand.  Look forward to taking Social Dance 2!  :)

Incredibly fun class. I'll admit I was nervous about dancing with a bunch of guys I didn't know, but I think that the class really grew me in terms of my self respect and self esteem. I think dancing is great now, and Steve is really a very gifted teacher. He really wants you to do well and have fun. Mmmhmmm.

Wow, what a blast! I was nervous when I went to the first class but Steve immediately put me at ease. We had fun all quarter, I think it was the only class I actually looked forward to going to!!! Take this class with Steve, you definitely won't regret it!
This class rocked... It was so much fun, real laid back and Steve is a cool guy
No Comments

This class was a blast! Steve doesn't care who shows up, so invite your friends. He's super laid-back, so his style of teaching's kinda ADD; you'll practice at least 4 diff. dances in a night. The final project/dance with a partner was fun, and he made a DVD of it. Ask him how to do some awesome dips, lifts, and flips; he's happy to show you.
Steve is AMAZING!  I love him!

I had Social Dance 1 with steve as well, he's just awesome! I've been to two other social dance classes to make up for absences, and they were nothing like ours. Skill level-wise,etc... I'd say, after having Steve, you really can't stand taking the class with other instructors =p
Steve ROCKS! Class is fun to attend. Even if you don't like dance...take the class...It's Steve!

Mr. Steve Yao's ballroom instruction has a strong emphasis on fundamentals.  Steve's teaching style of social dance has elements of dance acrobatics and covers well the basic's of smooth and latin rhythm dances.  This class is essential for the beginner intermediate.
i think steve would die for my sins... hes that good.
great... (-:
He's just awesome!
Steve's awesome, he should teach more classes- makes dancing awesome

Be prepared to put in a lot of outside work and to sit through long and boring lectures. For the class you do about 7 projects each taking over 80 pictures. If you have a strong passion for photography go for it, otherwise beware. Ardine is nice and friendly but is a tough grader. You really have to work to receive a good grade in this class.

If you are not majoring in Art or Design, DO NOT take this class..I pretty regret that I didn't drop it before the deadline. It is really ridiculous that 3-credits class takes 6 hours for a week, excluding your assignment time, which might need more than 3 or 4 hours for each assignment, and they grade you in a strict way as well as the midterm

If photography is a passion of yours, Ardine's class will be right up your ally. If you're looking to get a GE out of the way, you'll probably find assignments to be tedious and lectures to be very long and boring. It's a lot of work to pile on top of other labor-intensive GEs. I do not recommend for those just trying to get a GE out of the way.

Ardine is one of the most knowledgeable people in photography that you will meet. She is also always willing to help trouble shoot. Unfortunately she does not give sufficient time to complete projects and she is not lenient in grading even when she knows that you tried really hard and everything went wrong. (Almost no work time in class either)

Ardine knows everything about photography.  She can sometimes go over your head but she stop her and she will explain until you understand.  A wealth of knowledge combined with many years of experience.  I highly recommend Ardine Ohio State is lucky to have her.
Really a stellar person - knows her stuff and will go to extremes to help a student.  She really is just aweseome!
No Comments
very dedicated to students!  strict follower of rules and policies.  knows everything about equipment.  very understanding.

Can be quite flexible, almost to the point of being directionless. So maybe not the best teacher for lower level classes, but fantastic for people who are led by their own direction. Amazingly knowlageable and always helpful.

Nikki expects entirely too much from her students, considering the class is 100-level. She treats everyone like they are beneath her and as though everyone is supposed to produce work like Van Gogh. She treats students very unfairly and is often very rude. If you skip class, you won't pass. Don't take unless you absolutely must.

Nikki knows art. She is no nonsense and very consistent in her expectations. I learned a great deal in this class and appreciate her critiques because she is all about helping you develop your skill. If you want technical knowledge listen and put in the effort. I would take more classes with Niki as the instructor.

Teaching at George Mason University now. She grew on me. Extremely clear about what she wants. Expects a good deal. She is fairly tough, but not unreasonable. Don't be a slacker, you will not do well if you don't listen to what she wants or if you show up late. I wasn't so sure of the class in the beginning, but ended up really enjoying it.

Difficult to get an A, but if you show progression in your drawings, your grade will reflect. All projects are done outside class and you can't sit (which kills your feet) but I really learned alot and supplies were relatively inexpensive for an art class.

she knows what she's doing and she expects you to work. she won't pass you for just showing up to class and turning in assignments. this is college, and you must actually try. if you produce garbage, she'll pretty much tell you that it's garbage. Also, yes, she is very easy on the eyes. get on her good side.

Ratings.comment: i have been following her status for more than 10 years now. i,ve known louise since she was doing her final exams being educated as a professional artist.and have to admit she develloped tremendously as an succesful intern.artist the use of colour is  even for me still something i recognise as authentic. what she does nowadays  is more abstract.

Out of all my years at OSU she is one of my most favorite teachers. Some assignments were confusing, but she helped you out as much as you needed. She also pointed me in a direction that I never knew that was option. Love Her and Her Class.

Louise is amaaaaazing.  She's inspiring, and she has an eerily accurate eye for whatever you're up to.  She'll kick your ass, but you'll be thanking her for it every step of the way.  Sounds cheesy, but I really feel like I "grew" under her tutelage, and I can't wait to take more of her classes.

I LOVE THIS TEACHER.  She is the best most understanding person and instructor.  She is open to new possiblities and is inspirational.  She makes you want to be a better artist.  Take any class you can find that she is teaching.  It will be worth every moment.

It's been a couple of years since I took his intro to printmaking course... but I still look back and think of how much I learned from Ian. His classes are a lot of work and if you are lazy or want your grade handed to you, this is not the way to go. But if you really want to learn and have your mind awakened, it's worth your while.
Wow, first day, I am so intimidated. I think this is going to either be the best class I've ever taken or I'll die in the studio. He's really cute, weird, strict, and funny.

I dropped this class because I was already taking another studio class and could not find the time to complete the projects for this one. He's an alright guy, pretty vague, but okay. He will spend the full 3 hours demonstrating - be prepared. However you will learn a ton... wish I could have stayed in it.

I learned so much from him and wish he taught every class for me! He is difficult, but I am not paying to take classes to learn little and get an easy A. I learned a lot about printmaking and myself in his class. He is very knowledgeable, thorough, and does great demos.

I have never learned so much in ten weeks. And not just technique, he is a ridiculous resource. Our discussions were open, insightful, and he is not afraid to tell you what he thinks. Actually he can be a little scary, but in a good way. WE as a class were moved. I'll never forget it. I wish he taught more classes. I would take them all.

The workload is ridiculous and the expectations for being an intro class are absurd.  If you enjoy redoing every assignment then this is the class to take. Not worth taking if there is any other alternative.

This class was WAY too much work for an intro class. 20 hours a week outside of class SERIOUSLY, he means it. From what I have heard from the other class they had less work (no papers or folio). The critiques where good and difficult, but I learned a little about myself from them. I got a lot of good work, but I wish I had taken painting. I give A-
No Comments
He is great with Printmaking!!! but teaching Concepts, whose idea was that?
He is the first teacher to really actually push my brain during a crit. and he is really funny
Incredibly insightful! He never stops working
amazingly helpful and considerate prof! I learned a lot from him.
No Comments

Had him for Concepts and Issues, and the class was so bor-ing. Redudant AND repetitive (haha), not to mention completely useless.  Why doesn't the university just require Philosophy of the Arts (Phil. 145), as it's a far superior class?

This person is masterful at implying content to what he says and does. I prefer substance. Seems to have a predilection towards the avant garde, and is dismissive of many types of work he feels has been sufficiently represented historically, although his personal work looks like lo-grade 1950's Ab-Ex. Go figure.

Allen cannot communicate. He dominates critiques and goes on for hour unending about irrelevant information. He insults his students (he called my work crap). He is unprofessional and should not be teaching. Avoid him at all costs unless painting is your life- otherwise he will not respect you.

Alan is awesome. I knew the first time I met him that I wanted him as an advisor. He does digress and this bothers some people, but I find it interesting... he has so much knowledge and so much to add. If you want an inspired and inspiring prof. he's for you.

Alan is a master of interesting/informative digressions and oozes passion for the art world. He has a bias towards the extreme avant-garde, so traditional artists may find the class a bit disheartening at first but the inspiration he imparts will drive you to push yourself in directions you wouldn't expect.  A very knowledgeable, fun prof.

Very good guy, but unfortunately his teaching style caters primarily to students interested in pursuing very postmodern, nontraditional artistic methods; you won't hear the word "technique" thrown around too much in his class, but otherwise he'll be very supportive.

Malcolm is the best art professor I've had as an art major in Columbus. If you listen to him and understand that you're a student and you don't know it all, you will learn so much from him. Malcolm is the most challenging professor I have ever had, but he is also the best art professor I have come across.
